text: After weeks of research, I still cant find any clear information on how much we can use the API. There are some rules mentioned on the Betfair website but only basic stuff about like not making more calls per hour than 5,000 for example but there is no information on how often you can use it within a month for example. I've already got one suspension (reactivated now) and I have no idea why. Just for context I probably made less than 5,000 calls in 3 months when I got the suspension.

elements.text: After weeks of research, I still cant find any clear information on how much we can use the API. There are some rules mentioned on the Betfair website but only basic stuff about like not making more calls per hour than 5,000 for example but there is no information on how often you can use it within a month for example. I've already got one suspension (reactivated now) and I have no idea why. Just for context I probably made less than 5,000 calls in 3 months when I got the suspension.

text: I don't think there will be hard and fast "fair usage" terms on this one. If you are genuinely betting then it shouldn't matter

elements.text: I don't think there will be hard and fast "fair usage" terms on this one. If you are genuinely betting then it shouldn't matter

text: Im not sure genuinely betting matters either though. I've lost thousands in that period. If that isn't genuinely betting I don't know what is.

elements.text: Im not sure genuinely betting matters either though. I've lost thousands in that period. If that isn't genuinely betting I don't know what is.

text: Can you use streaming for connectivity and keep it to less than 1K transactions an hour and try to generate some commissions? That should be fair usage likely

elements.text: Can you use streaming for connectivity and keep it to less than 1K transactions an hour and try to generate some commissions? That should be fair usage likely

text: 5k calls in 3 months isn't a lot. Seems hard to believe Betfair would suspend for that. I'd suggest asking them, in detail why you were suspended so that you can avoid future issues.

elements.text: 5k calls in 3 months isn't a lot. Seems hard to believe Betfair would suspend for that. I'd suggest asking them, in detail why you were suspended so that you can avoid future issues.

text: I gather some data to inform my trades. I'm actually very good at it but I didn't mind losing money while testing some things.  I don't place trades with the API. I don't think that should matter though? The money is still going through Betfair just their normal web UI. The reason I mention that is because just gathering data I don't really need streaming. Im just doing snapshots, not in-play live trading with the API.

elements.text: I gather some data to inform my trades. I'm actually very good at it but I didn't mind losing money while testing some things.  I don't place trades with the API. I don't think that should matter though? The money is still going through Betfair just their normal web UI. The reason I mention that is because just gathering data I don't really need streaming. Im just doing snapshots, not in-play live trading with the API.

text: I think that is likely the problem. Your usage may look like just scraping the platform to inform some other commercial offering. I suggest using streaming, not snaps and betting through the api, generate commissions and you should not run into issues.

elements.text: I think that is likely the problem. Your usage may look like just scraping the platform to inform some other commercial offering. I suggest using streaming, not snaps and betting through the api, generate commissions and you should not run into issues.

text: <@U01DCR5PXDY> I spoke with them. They just said they don't keep info on it they can share with me. They just sent me a link to the TOS again where it mentioned they may suspend people if they suspect people are using the free API commercially. In fact when I was banned I was just watching games with Betangel but I was placing trades too so I wasn't gaming their system in any way. Makes it hard to know what to do next as after all this work they could just suspend my access.

elements.text: I spoke with them. They just said they don't keep info on it they can share with me. They just sent me a link to the TOS again where it mentioned they may suspend people if they suspect people are using the free API commercially. In fact when I was banned I was just watching games with Betangel but I was placing trades too so I wasn't gaming their system in any way. Makes it hard to know what to do next as after all this work they could just suspend my access.

text: Ok well I appreciate the help and chat but it's still all a little vague and subjective.

elements.text: Ok well I appreciate the help and chat but it's still all a little vague and subjective.

text: Of them I mean of course :)

elements.text: Of them I mean of course :)

text: Doesn't seem like an issue of using the API too much then. When I was very early on they took issue with my usage of the API and were able to give me exact numbers on my level of usage. Like <@U01B8031PM1> suggested, try making bets using the API to make clear what you are using the data for.

elements.text: Doesn't seem like an issue of using the API too much then. When I was very early on they took issue with my usage of the API and were able to give me exact numbers on my level of usage. Like
suggested, try making bets using the API to make clear what you are using the data for.

text: So if I snapshot all markets from say 50 games a day I should be fine? Of course, I will be giving them some of my money through betting/trading. I would imagine that is less demanding than watching a whole game with streaming.

elements.text: So if I snapshot all markets from say 50 games a day I should be fine? Of course, I will be giving them some of my money through betting/trading. I would imagine that is less demanding than watching a whole game with streaming.

text: None of us can tell you what behavior will be fine from Betfair's perspective. All I can say is that in your shoes, I'd start making some bets using the API, regardless of level of usage.

elements.text: None of us can tell you what behavior will be fine from Betfair's perspective. All I can say is that in your shoes, I'd start making some bets using the API, regardless of level of usage.

text: Have you guys seen a way to index the markets? I made a JSON with the order I want the markets in for my database. They seem to be fetched in a random order otherwise. I guess since the market_id changes. Doesnt really matter now so just wondering if I missed something on that.

elements.text: Have you guys seen a way to index the markets? I made a JSON with the order I want the markets in for my database. They seem to be fetched in a random order otherwise. I guess since the market_id changes. Doesnt really matter now so just wondering if I missed something on that.

text:
Hi guys! I wonder why the `list_event()` and `list_market_catalogue()` functions don't show the same information when using the same filter criteria `{marketTypeCodes', ['MATCH_ODDS']}` .
The `list_event()` function returned 647 events with these criteria, but the `list_market_catalogue()` only returned 40 markets, and the first 3 are called "*Moneyline*" by the way:
```MarketId: 1.215931259 - MarketName: Moneyline - TotalMatched: 871.42512

I was expecting `list_market_catalogue()` to bring all markets with type `MATCH_ODDS`, and if a have 647 events with this market, I wouldn't expect less than that.
Do you know why this behavior?  Am I getting this right? Or Am I missing something?
